results.title: UX Developer (HTML & Tailwind CSS Specialist)
results.description:
DockYard is hiring an HTML/CSS Specialist to collaborate closely with our in-house Design and Engineering teams to facilitate the handoff between visual design and implementation.

Who We Are

DockYard is a remote first, digital product consultancy. Forward-thinking teams come to us to build digital products that scale as their users, features, and complexity grow.

Using a candid approach to partnerships, we help to upskill teams along the way. The result? More flexibility in how our clients take products from idea to impact.

We don't just use innovative approaches to product development ‚Äì we lead them. That's why visionary companies like Netflix and Apple have trusted us to overcome complex product challenges.

We're honored to have been included on guides ranging from The Startup Weekly's Exceptional Workplace Award (2021), The BBJ's Fast 50 (2021, 2020), Inc 5000 (2020, 2019) and Fast Company's Best Places to Work for Innovators (2020) amongst others.

The Role

Our workflow involves three steps. Designers hand off mockups to the UX developers who then give styled templates to engineers. Traditionally writing HTML and CSS was the responsibility of designers or engineers, but with the rapid growth of HTML5, CSS3 and Tailwind, we believe that there needs to be a role within the team solely focused on those technologies.

The ideal candidate is one who perpetually seeks to sharpen their HTML skills, is fluent in Tailwind, and stays up to date on emerging web standards.¬† DockYard UX Developers continuously strive to achieve clean, semantic, accessible markup.

Responsibilities

  • Own the HTML & Tailwind CSS development of modern web applications
  • Assist in scoping, estimating, and planning for projects, in collaboration with the team lead.
  • Participate in work review, pairing, or other forms of knowledge sharing.

Must Haves

  • Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and Tailwind CSS
  • Demonstrate proficiency in translating design into code
  • Understanding of industry best practices
  • Understanding of BEM methodology
  • Comfortable developing outside of any CSS frameworks (no Bootstrap, Foundation, etc.)
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English

Nice To Haves

  • Knowledge of PostCSS and SMACSS
  • Familiarity with a11y practices
  • Experience with Sketch and Git preferred
  • Prior client services, consulting, or freelancing experience
  • Experience working in a remote team

Employment Type

Contractor (32 hours per week)

Level

Mid to Senior-Level

Location

Remote (U.S. based only)

DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

National Account Executive - 12 Month FTC
Client Growth Delivered (Homebased)

The role of the SalesOut National Account Executive is to support the National Account Manager(s) aim of partnering with SalesOut customer(s) and ensuring long-term success. This is achieved through regular collaboration, networking and training with the customer's teams and their suppliers to deliver a great customer experience and the successful delivery of our solutions.¬† They will need to understand their customer(s) / suppliers(s) key growth strategy and support them by the use of the SalesOut system to identify any potential growth areas, that will in turn add value, drive profitable sales, increase income streams and provide a return on investment to all parties against the SalesOut system.

The primary focus of the role is to build and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, to deliver year on year renewals of existing and new data subscriptions and revenue, plus use any other activities or initiatives as required (such as analytics to the wholesaler management team), to grow our income or add value.

The National Account Executive will need to spend time with the Account Management team (and their wholesalers) to build a strong network of contacts and to work with them collaboratively as a trusted partner.¬† They will also spend time in the IRI Bracknell office to liaise face to face with cross-functional and internal teams, to ensure we deliver a great customer experience, providing timely and successful delivery of our solutions and executing with excellence.

Main role responsibilities:

  • Support towards the deliverable targets for Wholesaler Revenue (Contract, Subscriptions, Smart Cash etc)

  • Knowledge of the FMCG wholesale/retail industry preferable (but not required)


ABOUT IRI:

What we do:
IRI is a leading provider of big data, predictive analytics and forward-looking insights that help FMCG, healthcare, retailers, and media companies to grow their businesses. With the largest collection of purchase, media, social, causal and loyalty data, all integrated on an on-demand cloud-based technology platform, IRI guides its clients around the world in their quests to remain relevant, capture market share, connect with consumers, and deliver market leading growth.

  • Innovation:

  • Creativity:

¬†

What working for IRI can do for you:
